name: Appendix Page
description: Back-matter section containing supplementary material such as methodology notes, data sources, extended tables, glossary items, or endnotes. Visually de-emphasized compared to main body, using compact typography and optional g10 background.

grid.margins: $spacing-07 (32px) top margin below appendix header, $spacing-05 (16px) between items

components: Appendix header: $heading-05 with appendix letter/number (e.g., 'Appendix A: Methodology')
Body text: $body-long-01 for prose descriptions, $body-short-01 for list items
Reference list: ordered or unordered list with $body-short-01 in $text-02
Optional data table: compact DataTable variant with smaller $label-01 cells
Section dividers: $ui-03 horizontal rules between appendix sub-sections
Optional footnote markers: superscript $label-01 linking to endnotes
rules: Appendix pages always start on a new page — use page-break-before: always
Appendix header uses $heading-05 — one level below chapter-opener to signal supplementary status
Body text uses $body-long-01 — same as main body but appendix content may use a slightly smaller type scale if space is tight
Reference lists use hanging indent (first line flush, continuation indented $spacing-05) for readability
Tables in appendix use compact variant: $label-01 cell text, reduced $spacing-03 cell padding
Each appendix section separated by a $ui-03 horizontal rule with $spacing-07 above and below
Appendix numbering continues from main document (if main has 5 chapters, appendix starts with Appendix A)
Maximum density: appendix may use 2-column layout for reference lists to save page count

printBehavior.pagePosition: after main body, before back cover

accessibilityNotes: Each appendix section should use <section aria-label='Appendix A: ...'> for navigation
Footnote references must use <a href='#fn-N'> linking to the corresponding endnote for keyboard navigation
Compact tables must maintain the same <thead>/<th> structure as full-size tables — never simplify semantics
Horizontal rules between sections should use <hr> with role='separator' for correct screen reader behavior
antiPatterns: Never style appendix content with the same visual weight as main body — it must be visually subordinate
Never omit page-break-before on appendix sections — they must not run into the final body chapter
Never use $display-* or $heading-06+ for appendix headers — reserve large type scales for main content
Never include critical findings or conclusions only in the appendix — essential information belongs in the main body
Never let appendix tables exceed page width — use compact column widths and abbreviations rather than horizontal overflow
